t: Jeremiah 51
The Utter Destruction of Babylon
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn I will raise up against Babylon, Against*ld those who dwell in Leb Kamai, A*ld destroying wind.
And*ld I will send winnowers to Babylon, Who*ld shall winnow her and empty her land. For*ld in the day of doom They*ld shall be against her all around.
Against*ld her*i let the archer bend his bow, And*ld lift himself up against her*i in his armor. Do*ld not spare her young men; Utterly*ld destroy all her army.
Thus*ld the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, And*ld those*i thrust through in her streets.
For*ld Israel is not forsaken, nor Judah, By*ld his God, the Lord*s of hosts, Though*ld their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.”
Flee*ln from the midst of Babylon, And*ld every one save his life! Do*ld not be cut off in her iniquity, For*ld this is*i the time of the Lord’s*s vengeance; He*ld shall recompense her.
Babylon*ld was*i a golden cup in the Lord’s*s hand, That*ld made all the earth drunk. The*ld nations drank her wine; Therefore*ld the nations are deranged.
Babylon*ld has suddenly fallen and been destroyed. Wail*ld for her! Take*ld balm for her pain; Perhaps*ld she may be healed.
We*ld would have healed Babylon, But*ld she is not healed. Forsake*ld her, and let us go everyone to his own country; For*ld her judgment reaches to heaven and is lifted up to the skies.
The*ld Lord*s has revealed our righteousness. Come*ld and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord*s our God.

Make*ln the arrows bright! Gather*ld the shields! The*ld Lord*s has raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes. For*ld His plan is*i against Babylon to destroy it, Because*ld it is*i the vengeance of the Lord,*s The*ld vengeance for His temple.

Set*ld up the standard on the walls of Babylon; Make*ld the guard strong, Set*ld up the watchmen, Prepare*ld the ambushes. For*ld the Lord*s has both devised and done What*ld He spoke against the inhabitants of Babylon.
O*ld you who dwell by many waters, Abundant*ld in treasures, Your*ld end has come, The*ld measure of your covetousness.
The*ld Lord*s of hosts has sworn by Himself: “Surely*ld I will fill you with men, as with locusts, And*ld they shall lift up a shout against you.”
He*ln has made the earth by His power; He*ld has established the world by His wisdom, And*ld stretched out the heaven by His understanding.

When*ld He utters His*i voice— There*ild is*i a multitude of waters in the heavens: “He*ld causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; He*ld makes lightnings for the rain; He*ld brings the wind out of His treasuries.”
Everyone*ln is dull-hearted, without knowledge; Every*ld metalsmith is put to shame by the carved image; For*ld his molded image is*i falsehood, And*ld there*i is*i no breath in them.
They*ld are*i futile, a work of errors; In*ld the time of their punishment they shall perish.
The*ld Portion of Jacob is*i not like them, For*ld He is*i the Maker of all things; And*ld Israel*i is*i the tribe of His inheritance. The*ld Lord*s of hosts is*i His name.
“You*ln are*i My battle-ax and*i weapons of war: For*ld with you I will break the nation in pieces; With*ld you I will destroy kingdoms;
With*ld you I will break in pieces the horse and its rider; With*ld you I will break in pieces the chariot and its rider;
With*ld you also I will break in pieces man and woman; With*ld you I will break in pieces old and young; With*ld you I will break in pieces the young man and the maiden;
With*ld you also I will break in pieces the shepherd and his flock; With*ld you I will break in pieces the farmer and his yoke of oxen; And*ld with you I will break in pieces governors and rulers.
“And*ln I will repay Babylon And*ld all the inhabitants of Chaldea For*ld all the evil they have done In*ld Zion in your sight,” says the Lord.*s

“Behold,*ln I am*i against you, O destroying mountain, Who*ld destroys all the earth,” says the Lord.*s “And*ld I will stretch out My hand against you, Roll*ld you down from the rocks, And*ld make you a burnt mountain.
They*ld shall not take from you a stone for a corner Nor*ld a stone for a foundation, But*ld you shall be desolate forever,” says the Lord.*s

Set*ln up a banner in the land, Blow*ld the trumpet among the nations! Prepare*ld the nations against her, Call*ld the kingdoms together against her: Ararat,*ld Minni, and Ashkenaz. Appoint*ld a general against her; Cause*ld the horses to come up like the bristling locusts.
Prepare*ld against her the nations, With*ld the kings of the Medes, Its*ld governors and all its rulers, All*ld the land of his dominion.
And*ld the land will tremble and sorrow; For*ld every purpose of the Lord*s shall be performed against Babylon, To*ld make the land of Babylon a desolation without inhabitant.

The*ld mighty men of Babylon have ceased fighting, They*ld have remained in their strongholds; Their*ld might has failed, They*ld became like*i women; They*ld have burned her dwelling places, The*ld bars of her gate*i are broken.
One*ld runner will run to meet another, And*ld one messenger to meet another, To*ld show the king of Babylon that his city is taken on all*i sides;
The*ld passages are blocked, The*ld reeds they have burned with fire, And*ld the men of war are terrified.

For*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel: “The*pn daughter of Babylon is*i like a threshing floor When*ild it is time to thresh her; Yet*ld a little while And*ld the time of her harvest will come.”

“Nebuchadnezzar*ln the king of Babylon Has*ld devoured me, he has crushed me; He*ld has made me an empty vessel, He*ld has swallowed me up like a monster; He*ld has filled his stomach with my delicacies, He*ld has spit me out.
Let*ld the violence done*i to me and my flesh be*i upon Babylon,” The*ld inhabitant of Zion will say; “And*ld my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea!” Jerusalem*ld will say.
Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn I will plead your case and take vengeance for you. I*ld will dry up her sea and make her springs dry.
Babylon*ld shall become a heap, A*ld dwelling place for jackals, An*ld astonishment and a hissing, Without*ld an inhabitant.
They*ld shall roar together like lions, They*ld shall growl like lions’ whelps.
In*ld their excitement I will prepare their feasts; I*ld will make them drunk, That*ld they may rejoice, And*ld sleep a perpetual sleep And*ld not awake,” says the Lord.*s
“I*ld will bring them down Like*ld lambs to the slaughter, Like*ld rams with male goats.
“Oh,*ln how Sheshach is taken! Oh,*ld how the praise of the whole earth is seized! How*ld Babylon has become desolate among the nations!
The*ld sea has come up over Babylon; She*ld is covered with the multitude of its waves.
Her*ld cities are a desolation, A*ld dry land and a wilderness, A*ld land where no one dwells, Through*ld which no son of man passes.
I*ld will punish Bel in Babylon, And*ld I will bring out of his mouth what he has swallowed; And*ld the nations shall not stream to him anymore. Yes,*ld the wall of Babylon shall fall.
“My*ln people, go out of the midst of her! And*ld let everyone deliver himself from the fierce anger of the Lord.*s

And*ld lest your heart faint, And*ld you fear for the rumor that will*i be*i heard in the land (A*ld rumor will come one*i year, And*ld after that, in another*i year A*ld rumor will*i come,*i And*ld violence in the land, Ruler*ld against ruler),
Therefore*ld behold, the days are coming That*ld I will bring judgment on the carved images of Babylon; Her*ld whole land shall be ashamed, And*ld all her slain shall fall in her midst.
Then*ld the heavens and the earth and all that is*i in them Shall*ld sing joyously over Babylon; For*ld the plunderers shall come to her from the north,” says the Lord.*s
As*ln Babylon has*i caused*i the slain of Israel to fall, So*ld at Babylon the slain of all the earth shall fall.
You*ld who have escaped the sword, Get*ld away! Do not stand still! Remember*ld the Lord*s afar off, And*ld let Jerusalem come to your mind.
We*ln are ashamed because we have heard reproach. Shame*ld has covered our faces, For*ld strangers have come into the sanctuaries of the Lord’s*s house.
“Therefore*ln behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,*s “That*ld I will bring judgment on her carved images, And*ld throughout all her land the wounded shall groan.
Though*ld Babylon were to mount up to heaven, And*ld though she were to fortify the height of her strength, Yet*ild from Me plunderers would come to her,” says the Lord.*s
The*ln sound of a cry comes*i from Babylon, And*ld great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans,
Because*ld the Lord*s is plundering Babylon And*ld silencing her loud voice, Though*ld her waves roar like great waters, And*ld the noise of their voice is uttered,

Because*ld the plunderer comes against her, against Babylon, And*ld her mighty men are taken. Every*ld one of their bows is broken; For*ld the Lord*s is*i the God of recompense, He*ld will surely repay.

“And*ln I will make drunk Her*ld princes and wise men, Her*ld governors, her deputies, and her mighty men. And*ld they shall sleep a perpetual sleep And*ld not awake,” says the King, Whose*ld name is*i the Lord*s of hosts.

Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: “The*pn broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, And*ld her high gates shall be burned with fire; The*ld people will labor in vain, And*ld the nations, because of the fire; And*ld they shall be weary.”
Jeremiah’s Command to Seraiah

The*p word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And Seraiah was*i the quartermaster.
So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that would come upon Babylon, all these words that are written against Babylon.
And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you arrive in Babylon and see it, and read all these words,
then you shall say, ‘O Lord,*s You have spoken against this place to cut it off, so that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but it shall be desolate forever.’
Now it shall be, when you have finished reading this book, that*i you shall tie a stone to it and throw it out into the Euphrates.
Then you shall say, ‘Thus Babylon shall sink and not rise from the catastrophe that I will bring upon her. And they shall be weary.’” Thus*p far are*i the words of Jeremiah.
